YES, videos are nice, and your are visualy crazy and memorable, but as you just said, you write and record songs 4x times faster than making a video. so bill, my good man, you have a ton of compositions to actually record for our ears delight, just put the songs on youtube with a spinning record and thats IT. make a full on video for like "singles" if i may out it that way.

i'm sorry about my ranting here, you are already bombarded with questions, requests and all, but i love your songs so much it pains me to see that you think that only videos could help you spread your music, that's why i think that a simple visual on youtube would still get you millions of views/listens, and keep big videos for songs that particularly call you for a complimentary video.

8.7.17  12:48 am   8.6.17  3:59 pm  8.5.17  3:21 pm RE: RE: bilabial trill and oven display: I've never met anyone else who can do this! I try to explain it to people but they can't seem to do it. They probably don't believe me that it's real.

This happens because some lights flicker with the AC power at 50 or 60 Hz, and some of the segments are out of phase with the others. So if you vibrate your head up and down at about the same frequency, you see some lights appear to be higher or lower than others, depending whether your head is at the top or bottom of its vibration when that light flickers.

I find it works best with LED Christmas lights, but oven displays are pretty good too.

8.6.17  8:32 pm   i just. i love it when picked or plucked strings sound SOAPY. you can hear it on a bright acoustic guitar but... even more on a banjo or mandolin. there's something about the satisfying, slippery but solid texture of that sound that makes me think of soap. even dragging a pick across a string sounds like what it feels like to run your fingernail over a bar of soap. all the little stops and starts. mmmm. yummy right
